info.title: 0CodeKit API
info.description: The API documentation for 0CodeKit, a low- and no-code platform for automation using Make, Zapier or n8n.

post.description: Provides access to most of the functionality of 0CodeKit, including everything that costs credits.
This API retrieve a list of holidays for a specific year, country code, and optionally state.

year.description: The year for which holidays are requested.

state.description: The state within the country (if applicable).

post.description: This endpoint can be used to return varied calendar-week information according to the data passed in the request.

date.description: The date parameter provides the week number of the year relative to the date, along with the starting and ending week.

weekNumber.description: The weekNumber parameter provides the workingDate of that week, along with the starting and ending day of the week.

year.description: The year parameter provides year of the given weekNumber.

post.description: This API calculates month, year, start date, end date, and weekdays within a specified duration from a given start date.

duration.description: Duration of days for which the detail period is retrieved.

post.description: Converts a date and time from one timezone to another.

inputTime.description: The time that will be converted.

inputTimeZone.description: The timezone of the input time.

formatPattern.description: The format of the output time.

destinationTimeZone.description: The timezone of the output time.

post.description: This retrieves all workdays, saturdays, sundays, and days in the month based on the month, year, and date provided.
Determine if a given date is a weekend, retrieve the day number, and get the weekday.

date.description: The date for which information is requested.

dateFormat.description: The format of the input date.

post.description: Uploads a file buffer to temporary storage and provides a URL. The file is deleted after 24 hours.

fileName.description: The file name. Default is a random string.

url.description: The URL to download the file.

fileName.description: The file name used to upload the file.

post.description: Searches text for keywords and returns their positions.

text.description: Text from which you want to find keywords.

post.description: Calculate similarity score between two strings
Extracts text from body between given start and end markers

body.description: Body from which to extract the text

greedy.description: When true, It include start and end marker in result.

caseSensitive.description: When true, It make the body case sensitive.

returnEmptyIfNotFound.description: When true, Return error if markers not found.

hue.description: The hue of the generated color. Default is random.

luminosity.description: The luminosity of the generated color. Default is random.

seed.description: A number or string that is used as a seed for the random number generator. By default, no seed is used.

format.description:
The format of the returned color. These are the possible formats:
- `rgb`: `rgb(0, 0, 0)`
- `rgba`: `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)`
- `hsl`: `hsl(0, 0%, 0%)`
- `hsla`: `hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0)`
- `hex`: `#000000`

Default is `hex`.

alpha.description: A decimal between 0 and 1 that specifies the value of the alpha channel. This is only relevant when using a format with an alpha channel. Default is a random value.

range.description: The range of the generated number.

type.description: The type of generated number. Default is `integer`.

round.description: The number of decimal places the generated number has. This is only used if `type` is `decimal` or `float`.

post.description: Creates a summary of the given text.

prompt.example: Once upon a time, in a far away land, there lived a young girl who was full of dreams and aspirations. She was passionate about exploring the world and discovering all its secrets. She wanted to see the wonders of the world, to meet new people, to learn new things, and to experience life in all its glory. As a young girl, she often thought of what it would be like to journey to exotic places, to explore the unknown and to find her place in the world. She wanted to be free to make her own decisions, to choose her own destiny, and to be independent. ne day, she decided she was ready to embark on her quest. She packed her bags, said goodbye to her family, and set off on her travels. She went to places she had only dreamed of, and experienced things she had never imagined. She met people from all walks of life, made new friends, and experienced new cultures. She explored the great outdoors and embraced nature in all its beauty. She tried new foods, and found her favorite cuisines. Through it all, she found her own path and discovered her true purpose in life.

id.description: The ID of the generated content.

data.example: A young girl with dreams of exploring the world and experiencing life's wonders embarks on a journey to exotic places. She meets people from different cultures, tries new foods, and enjoys nature's beauty. Throughout her travels, she finds her own path and discovers her true purpose in life.

post.description: Transcribe an audio file to text. This supports the following file types: `flac`, `m4a`, `mp3`, `mp4`, `mpeg`, `mpga`, `oga`, `ogg`, `wav`, `webm`. The maximum file size is 25MB.

url.description: The URL to the audio file.

buffer.description: The Base64-encoded audio file. Can be provided instead of `url`.

text.example: Ladies and gentlemen, am I totally screwed, or what?

post.description: Check if the content is appropriate to be posted on the internet.

prompt.description: The text containing the content to be checked.

safe.description: Boolean value indicating if the content is safe.

data.description: The message containing the result of the content check.

post.description: Check if the content is appropriate for all audiences.

imageUrl.description: The URL of the image to be checked.

post.description: Returns the distance between a start and end point. The distance is calculated using a specific mode of travel, which can influence the route taken and is also used to estimate the amount of time it takes to travel.

distanceInKM.description: The distance between start and end point in kilometers when traveling.

duration.description: The estimated amount of time it takes to travel from start to end point.

post.description: Uses the height and weight of a person to calculate their BMI as well as several other related values, including their recommended nutrients.

kcal.description: The amount of energy in kilocalories required per day.

carbohydrates.description: The amount of carbohydrates in grams required per day.

protein.description: The amount of proteins in grams required per day.

fat.description: The amount of fat in grams required per day.

city.description: The city the IP address comes from.

zip.description: The zip code the IP address comes from.

timezone.description: The timezone the IP address is in.

query.description: The IP address that was queried.

post.summary: Convert between ISO and nation name.
post.description: Takes a nation name or a nation ISO code and outputs the corresponding nation name and ISO code.

iso.description: The ISO code of the nation.

nation.description: The English name of the nation.

iso.description: The ISO code of the nation.

nation.description: The English name of the nation.

post.description: Looks up the VAT rate for the specified country in the European Union.

countryCode.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country.

vat_name.description: The name of VAT in the country.

reduced_rate.description: The reduced VAT rate, or false.

reduced_rate_alt.description: The alternative reduced VAT rate, or false.

super_reduced_rate.description: The super reduced VAT rate, or false.

post.description: Checks whether the email address is from a free email provider.

email.description: The email address that should be checked.

freeEmailProvider.description: Whether the email provider is free.

provider.description: The provider domain extracted from the email address.

schema.description: The mapping from parameters to values.

post.description: Converts a shortened URL from any URL shortener to its expanded form.
Split a full name into its first and last name.

name.description: The full name that will be split.

reversed.description: Whether first and last name should be reversed. Might be useful in languages where the last name comes first, e.g. Chinese.

firstName.description: The first name. This might also be multiple first names.

fullname.description: The full name. The first name is only used if `firstname` is not provided.

firstname.description: The first name, either from `firstname` or `fullname`.

credits.description: The number of credits you have left.

binId.description: The ID of the JSON bin.
The ID of the JSON bin.

data.description: The content of the JSON bin.

post.description: Replaces the data in the JSON bin with the new data.

json.description: The JSON data to put into the bin.

binId.description: The ID of the JSON bin that will be modified.
The ID of the JSON bin that was modified.
The ID of the JSON bin.

post.description: Returns a list of the bin IDs of all JSON bins this user has created.

bins.description: The available JSON bins for this user.

binId.description: The ID of this JSON bin.

json.description: The JSON data to store in the bin.

binId.description: The ID that was assigned to this JSON bin.

post.description: The user can only access a global variable that they created themselves.

variableName.description: The name of the variable to get.

post.description: A global variable can only be deleted by the user that created it.

message.example: Successfully deleted global variable with id myVariable.

post.description: Changes the value of the given global variable to the new value.

variableName.description: The name of the variable to update.

variableValue.description: The new value of the variable.
The new value of the variable.

post.description: Lists all variables that the user has created before and not yet deleted.

variables.description: The list of variables for this user.

post.description: The global variable is only visible for the user that created it. If `variableName` is not provided, it is generated automatically.

variableName.description: The name of the variable to create. Default is auto-generated.

variableValue.description: The value to assign to the variable.

variableName.description: The variable name that was actually used.

variableValue.description: The value that was assigned to the variable.

post.description: Decodes a QR code from a URL or buffer and returns the encoded data. The supported file formats are `jpg`, `png`, `bmp`, `tiff`, `gif`.

url.description: The URL to the QR code.

buffer.description: The QR code as a Base64-encoded buffer. Can be used instead of `url`.

data.description: The data contained in the QR code.

post.description: Returns a QR code as a PNG image, styled using the provided settings.

data.description: The data that should be encoded

width.description: The width of the QR code in pixels. Default is 500.

height.description: The height of the QR code in pixels. Default is 500.

image.description: The URL of the image that should be put in the middle. By default, no image is used. The image covers up part of the QR code, which can only be recovered using error correction.

margin.description: The size of the space between the QR code and the border of the image in pixels. Default is 15.

qrOptions.description: Options for the QR code data.

typeNumber.description: The type of the QR code. This must be an integer between 1 and 40. The number of dots on each side of the QR code is 4 * type number + 17. If the type is too low to encode all data, the request will fail. By default, the QR code is sized as small as possible.

mode.description:
The mode of the QR code. This decides which characters are allowed in the QR code:

- `Numeric`: Only numbers from 0 to 9.
- `Alphanumeric`: Numbers from 0 to 9, latin letters from A to Z (only upper-case), spaces, and the following special characters: $, %, *, +, -, ., /, :.
- `Byte`: Any bytes.

For almost all cases, `Byte` is the correct choice, including for URLs. Default is `Byte`.

errorCorrectionLevel.description:
The error correction level. The higher the level is, the more likely it becomes the QR code can still be read in bad conditions, e.g. bad lighting, shaking, or when part of the code is hidden or destroyed. However, error correction also requires more data to be stored in the QR code, meaning the `typeNumber` will be higher. These are the approximate percentages of data that can be restored with the respective error correction levels:

- `L`: 7%
- `M`: 15%
- `Q`: 25%
- `H`: 30%

Default is `Q`.

imageOptions.description: Options for the image in the center of the QR code.

hideBackgroundDots.description: Whether the dots covered by the image should be hidden. Default is `true`.

margin.description: The size of the empty space around the image in pixels. Increasing the margin will decrease the image size. Default is 0.

dotsOptions.description: Options for the dots that make up most of the QR code.

type.description: The style of the dots. Default is `square`.

color.description: The color of the dots as a hexcode. Can only be used if `gradient` is not used. Default is `#000000`, i.e. black.

gradient.description: Options for a color gradient of the dots. Can only be used if `color` is not used.

type.description:
The type of gradient. This can be one of two options:

- `radial`: The gradient starts at the center of the image and moves outwards.
- `linear`: The gradient starts at one side and moves to the other.

rotation.description: The clockwise rotation of the gradient in degrees. Can only be used when `type` is linear. Default is no rotation.

colorStops.description: The color stops in the gradient.

offset.description: The offset where this color should be used. Must be between 0 and 1.

color.description: The color of this color stop as a hexcode.

cornersSquareOptions.description: Options for the corner squares. This does not influence the smaller dots inside the corner squares.

type.description: The style of the corner squares. Default is `square`.

color.description: The color of the corner squares as a hexcode. Can only be used if `gradient` is not used. Default is `#000000`, i.e. black.

gradient.description: Options for a color gradient of the corner squares. Can only be used if `color` is not used.

type.description:
The type of gradient. This can be one of two options:

- `radial`: The gradient starts at the center of the image and moves outwards.
- `linear`: The gradient starts at one side and moves to the other.

rotation.description: The clockwise rotation of the gradient in degrees. Can only be used when `type` is linear. Default is no rotation.

colorStops.description: The color stops in the gradient.

offset.description: The offset where this color should be used. Must be between 0 and 1.

color.description: The color of this color stop as a hexcode.

cornersDotOptions.description: Options for the corner dots. This does not influence the square border around the corner dots.

type.description: The style of the corner dots. Default is `square`.

color.description: The color of the corner dots as a hexcode. Can only be used if `gradient` is not used. Default is `#000000`, i.e. black.

gradient.description: Options for a color gradient of the corner squares. Can only be used if `color` is not used.

type.description:
The type of gradient. This can be one of two options:

- `radial`: The gradient starts at the center of the image and moves outwards.
- `linear`: The gradient starts at one side and moves to the other.

rotation.description: The clockwise rotation of the gradient in degrees. Can only be used when `type` is linear. Default is no rotation.

colorStops.description: The color stops in the gradient.

offset.description: The offset where this color should be used. Must be between 0 and 1.

color.description: The color of this color stop as a hexcode.

verify.description: Whether to verify the JWT. This requires `secret`. Default is `false`.

secret.description: The HMAC secret or PEM-encoded public key.

algorithms.description: The signature algorithms that should be accepted. By default, all algorithms are accepted.

algorithm.description: The signature algorithm to use. Default is `none`.

amount.description: The amount of users to generate. Default is 1.

code.description: The code extracted from the barcode.

format.description: The generated file type. Default is `svg`.

getAsUrl.description: Whether to get as URL or buffer. Default is buffer.

csv.description: The CSV string that will be parsed.

omitFirstRow.description: Whether to omit the first row. Default is false.

delimiter.description: The delimiter by which the rows will be split.

array.description: The array of rows, where each row is an array of fields.

csv.description: The CSV string that will be converted.

noheader.description: If this is false, the first line will be interpreted as column names instead of data. Default is false.

delimiter.description: The delimiter between the different columns. Can be `auto` for automatic detection of delimiters, or an array of delimiters. Default is `auto`.

trim.description: Whether spaces around column values should be trimmed. Default is true.

ignoreEmpty.description: Whether empty column values should be ignored, instead of being output as empty. Default is false.

json.description: An array of JSON objects parsed from the CSV.

post.description: Verifies a domain by performing an HTTP GET request against it.

mainDomain.description: The main domain name, without subdomain.

post.description: Checks whether the provided IBAN (International Bank Account Number) is valid.
Checks whether the phone number is valid.

phoneNumber.description: The given phone number to validate.

number.description: The international based on E164Number Code.

nationalNumber.description: The national number of the country.

countryCode.description: The country code based on the phone number.

possibleNumber.description: Checks if the given number is an possible phone number.

isValid.description: Checks whether the phone number is valid.

post.description: TODO

valid.description: Whether the E-Mail address is valid.

post.description: This endpoint takes an address or coordinates, and checks whether it is valid.

address.description: The location. Can be an address or coordinates.
The address if the location is valid.

post.description: Checks whether a BIC (Bank Identifier Code) is valid.
Checks whether the provided VAT (Valued Added Tax) ID is valid using a service provided by VIES, If available, this also returns the associated name and address

vatId.description: The VAT ID. Must start with a two-digit country code.

countryCode.description: The country code of the VAT ID.

id.description: The number part of the VAT ID.

requestDate.description: The exact date and time the request was made.

name.description: The name. Only provided if the ID is valid.

address.description: The address. Only provided if the address is valid.
